content.description: Start on the slab skirt and clip the belayers bolt. Make your way on to a questionable flake for the second bolt. Good, slightly hidden pockets on slab make up the remaining bolts. Move right through the small crack and go up over the ledge for the chains.
content.location: Near the left river access on Painted Canyon Sector.

content.description: Another technical and pockety climb with similar character to the other routes on this wall. Slightly easier than Catfish Wrangler, but still a solid 5.11.  First bolt is low to prevent closelining the leader on a fall above bolt 2.  Shares anchors with Turtle Lasso to its' left.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus a two bolt shared anchor with chains
content.location: Fourth route (left to right) on the wall and is the bolt line just to the right of the route that starts with the large flake (Turtle Lasso).

content.description: Bolted crack on the right side of the same buttress as Crackalicious.  Very dirty and over grown as of March 2021.  There is a 5.10 variation that unfortunately leaves the rope running around and over a sharp flake.  Better to rappel this route to avoid lowering across the sharp flake if you do the 5.10 variation.  Otherwise a fun bolted crack climb.
content.protection: 7-9 bolts plus a two bolt traditional anchor
content.location: Right side of buttress that Crackalicious is on.

content.description: Fun climb that leads up to a rightward curving crack.  Shares the same anchors as Catfish Wrangler to the right.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus two bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Leftmost route on the wall, see topo.

content.description: Area classic!  This climb has a little bit of everything.  Down low there's a few lay back moves into good corner climbing with comfortable clips and intuitive and fun movement.  The climb trends to the right through a crack system and lets up towards the top.  This climb feels airy and exposed with a beautiful view of painted canyon.  Best of the grade and definitely worth the wait.  Beware of easily avoidable loose blocks towards the top.
content.protection: 7-8 bolts to a two bolt anchor with rap rings
content.location: Hike past Painted Canyon a little ways until you see a large buttress with a bolted crack on the right side (Over Under Sideways Down).  Around the left side of the buttress is Crackalicious just before you get to Butterfly Stampede.

content.description: Much more difficult than original topo indicates.  There are a couple of ways to navigate the opening sequence which leads to difficult pocket moves up above.  Shares anchors with Nude Bass Wrestling to its' left.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus two bolt shared anchor with chains
content.location: Second route (left to right) on the wall.

content.description: This climb seasonally has large butterfly swarms overhead at the anchors.  A difficult opening move to a shallow pinch is a bit reachy (crux).  Find a decent rest up top before another red point crux moving off of the big undercling up and left to a gaston.  Separate anchors.
content.protection: 5-7 bolts plus a two bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Right most climb on the wall, but left of Crackalicious.  Wall has two horizontal 'caves' and the start of Butterfly Stampede is in the middle of the right cave.

content.description: Home to the area classic, destination worthy sport route this wall gets traffic just for the one route alone. On the right side of the buttress is another moderate bolted crack Over Under Sideways Down 5.9/5.10 and to the left are a collection of short and cryptic 5.11s.
